subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

The Fraud part is what he is saying about you Frank, that you charge thousa=
nds of dollars for your boxes.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Fra=
nk Sumption 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 =
9:10 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?


=




   It's not fraud, these hack boxes work, it's just the guy has no clue=
 how it works, and trends mis-represent it's function.  RS is in fact disco=
ntiuing the radios, although there appears the other--more expensive radios=
 that would work as boxes. 

   I know, I get kinda harsh, but if someone t=
o set themselves up as experts, at least understand the damn concepts  invo=
lved. Don't keep regurgitating the same urban myth crap that everyone else =
throws out there as facts.

   Frank-S


  On Thu, May 21, 2009 at 8:49 AM,=
 <SnowfireL@...> wrote:





    It's none of my business but, Frank wi=
ll need to call ebay the number can be found in the security section, and h=
e will have to let them know they are committing fraud, otherwise nothing w=
ill be done.  I saw these ads on ebay too, but I thought, Frank may have be=
en trying to earn some money for all his hard work, nothing wrong with that=
 either, that was before I joined these groups. sf





    In a message da=
ted 5/21/2009 10:45:09 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april@abercrombieghostre=
search.com writes:




      Yeah-the seller, but you can't contact the bid=
ders.

        ----- Original Message ----- 
        From: threadsintyme@ju=
no.com 
        To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
        Sent: Thursday, May 21=
, 2009 8:41 AM
        Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fr=
ank's Box?


        They most certainly do, Kristin. There is a place on t=
he ad where you can contact the seller directly and raise the issue with th=
e seller.
        Al
        ---------- Original Message ----------
       =
 From: "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@...>
        To: <EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com>
        Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fra=
nk's Box?
        Date: Thu, 21 May 2009 09:17:07 -0500




        I don=
=92t think EBAY allows people to contact the bidders anymore.. that=92s why=
 their names are partially hidden??  I know how you feel tho..



---------=
---------------------------------------------------------------

        Fr=
om: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of A=
pril Abercrombie
        Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 9:09 AM
        To: E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
        Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for =
sorta Frank's Box?







        Yes...I know.... but it is fun to fantasi=
ze. Plus, if I am in a position to make a difference I will. The problem is=
 knowing when or where that position is.


          ----- Original Message=
 ----- 

          From: Kristin Morris 

          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com 

          Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 7:56 AM

          Subject: R=
E: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?


          We can=92t=
 police the entire internet.  People should take responsibility for themsel=
ves and do some research and find out how this works before they purchase. =
 

          Caveat emptor..  


------------------------------------------=
----------------------------

          From: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com [mail=
to:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of April Abercrombie
          Sent: =
Thursday, May 21, 2009 8:45 AM
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
      =
    Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?







 =
         Exactly! That's what I'm sayin'.

          Wouldn't it be a hoot =
if Frank himself blasted the guy. But that isn't the mature way..... ;)

  =
          ----- Original Message ----- 

            From: threadsintyme@ju=
no.com 

            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 

            Sent: Thursd=
ay, May 21, 2009 5:52 AM

            Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay aucti=
on for sorta Frank's Box?

            Why don't some of us respond to his =
ad...and take serious issue with this business of his lying to the public a=
bout Frank? 

            That info is a serious breach of eBay policy. He =
could be banned from eBay for life. 
            Al
            ---------- =
Original Message ----------
            From: "Kristin Morris" <ckmorris95@=
sbcglobal.net>
            To: <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
            Subjec=
t: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Frank's Box?
            Date: =
Thu, 21 May 2009 06:16:27 -0500

            WOW.. Frank.  I didn=92t reali=
ze you were charging =96 and =93thousands of dollars=94 to boot!  Must be t=
o pay for that Faraday Cage and the white noise generator thing this yahoo =
believes are in all your creations.  And hurry because =93his supplier=94 (=
cough =96 cough Radio Shack) is discontinuing!  But no worries he has =93so=
ld over 2 dozen of these =91Frank=92s Boxes devices=94 so he must be legit =
because he knows =96 and actual customer bought a =91real=92 Frank=92s Box =
and said it was equal!  Awesome=85

            k


-----------------------=
---------------------------------------------

            From: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of ourobouros2k2
 =
           Sent: Thursday, May 21, 2009 12:50 AM
            To: EVP-ITC@ya=
hoogroups.com
            Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Ebay auction for sorta Fra=
nk's Box?








            Been following this unprofessional idiot's it=
ems for awhile now. I love how he says that Frank charges thousands of doll=
ars for an original Frank's box. 

            This dude is the worst type =
of con, preying on people who know only enough to be familiar with the term=
 Frank's box. Then again, it always has bothered me when people take shack =
hacks and charge stupid prices for them on ebay under the Frank's box monik=
er.

            This guy is based out of Nevada I believe, and his group's=
 ethics leave little to be desired. Takes all kinds, I reckon...

         =
   Andy

            --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Aquarius <laustin@...>=
 wrote:
            >
            > Hmmm... saw this on Ebay tonight... you=
've got to read all the text to hear
            > how he describes what he=
's selling. 
            > 
            > Do any of you on this list know w=
ho he is? I just thought this was kind of
            > interesting... see:=

            > 
            > http://tinyurl.com/o5pper
            > 
    =
        > Cheers,
            > 
            > Leslie, consistent lurker an=
d occasional poster <g>
            > 
            > "I'm not happy, I'm ch=
eerful. There's a difference. A happy woman has no
            > cares at a=
ll. A cheerful woman has cares but has learned how to deal with them."
    =

            > -- Beverly Sills (1929-) American Opera Singer
